title: THE BLACK WOLF
author: Louise Penny
description: The 20th book in the Chief Inspector Gamache series. After thwarting a terrorist attack, an injured Gamache leads a covert investigation.

title: THE WIDOW
author: John Grisham
description: When Simon Latch, a lawyer in rural Virginia, is accused of murder, he goes in search of the real killer.

title: BONDS OF HERCULES
author: Jasmine Mas
description: The second book in the Villains of Lore series. Seduction and danger put Hercules in a tough spot.

title: THE SECRET OF SECRETS
author: Dan Brown
description: As he searches for the missing noetic scientist he has been seeing, Robert Langdon discovers something regarding a secret project.

title: THE PROVING GROUND
author: Michael Connelly
description: The eighth book in the Lincoln Lawyer series. Mickey Haller enlists a journalist to help his lawsuit against an A.I. company.

title: NOBODY'S GIRL
author: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
description: The late activist and advocate for sex-trafficking survivors describes her time with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

title: HOW TO TEST NEGATIVE FOR STUPID
author: John Kennedy
description: The Republican senator from Louisiana shares stories about politics in Washington, D.C., and in his home state.

author: Andrew Ross Sorkin
description: The New York Times journalist and CNBC host looks at the fight between Washington and Wall Street that fueled a historic crash of the stock market.

title: OUTLIVE
author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.

title: THE UNCOOL
author: Cameron Crowe
description: The journalist and Academy Award-winning filmmaker shares real-life events that inspired “Almost Famous.”

title: THE PIONEER WOMAN COOKS: THE ESSENTIAL RECIPES
author: Ree Drummond

title: ALWAYS REMEMBER: THE BOY, THE MOLE, THE FOX, THE HORSE AND THE STORM
author: Charlie Mackesy

title: THE COURT OF THE DEAD
author: Rick Riordan and Mark Oshiro
description: Nico, Will and Hazel delve into the mysterious disappearances of monsters at Camp Jupiter. (Ages 10 to 14)

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE POISONED KING
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: Christopher and Anya must save the dragons of the Archipelago from a strange new threat. (Ages 10 and up)

title: POCKET BEAR
author: Katherine Applegate. Illustrated Charles Santoso
description: Zephyrina brings a rare stuffed bear back to the Second Chances Home for the Tossed and Treasured. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: HOW TO CATCH A MONSTER
author: Adam Wallace. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: A boy attempts to catch the monster in his closet. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: HOW TO CATCH A TURKEY
author: Adam Wallace. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: Students try to catch a runaway turkey before their Thanksgiving play. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: HOW TO CATCH A WITCH
author: Alice Walstead. Illustrated Megan Joyce
description: The Catch Club Kids attempt to snare a witch on Halloween. (Ages 4 to 7)

title: CREEPY PAIR OF UNDERWEAR
author: Aaron Reynolds. Illustrated Peter Brown
description: Jasper Rabbit deals with a pair of glowing underwear that won't go away. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE LEAF THIEF
author: Alice Hemming. Illustrated Nicola Slater
description: Squirrel attempts to figure out who has stolen his leaves. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: Jeff Kinney. Illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: LIGHTLARK SAGA
author: Alex Aster
description: Every 100 years the island of Lightlark appears and a deadly competition called the Centennial takes place. (Ages 13 and up)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE TWILIGHT SAGA
author: Stephenie Meyer
description: Vampires and werewolves and their intrigues in high school. (Ages 12 and up)

title: HAZELTHORN
author: C.G. Drews
description: The heir to the estate of Hazelthorn suspects that his benefactor was murdered. (Ages 13 to 18)

title: FAKE SKATING
author: Lynn Painter
description: After years of separation, the childhood friends Alec and Dani reunite and face their true feelings toward each other. (Ages 14 and up)

title: HOUR OF THE PUMPKIN QUEEN
author: Megan Shepherd
description: After a potion demonstration goes awry, Sally and Luna fall through a portal to Time Town. (Ages 12 and up)

title: BITTEN
author: Jordan Stephanie Gray
description: Vanessa seeks vengeance against the werewolves who attacked her and changed her life forever. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: NEVER EVER AFTER
author: Sue Lynn Tan
description: Yining must unravel the truth of her past with the help of a mysterious wooden ring. (Ages 14 to 18)
